skill.name: tasks-generator
skill.description: Generate structured task roadmaps from project specifications. Use when the user asks to create tasks, sprint plans, roadmaps, or work breakdowns based on PRD (Product Requirements Document), Tech Specs, or UI/UX specs. Triggers include requests like "generate tasks from PRD", "create sprint plan", "break down this spec into tasks", "create a roadmap", or "plan the implementation".
skill.summary: Generate structured task roadmaps from project specifications. Use when the user asks to create task...
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 101 potential issues across 3 files, all of which are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanned files are pure markdown documentation templates containing no executable code. The 'external_commands' detections are markdown code formatting backticks, 'weak_cryptographic_algorithm' are mentions of task decomposition patterns, and 'network_reconnaissance' are file path references to documentation. This is a documentation-only skill with no code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Transform PRD, Tech Specs, and UI/UX specifications into structured, actionable task roadmaps. The skill analyzes project requirements and generates a phased sprint plan with parallel task opportunities and dependency tracking.
actual_capabilities: Parse PRD documents to extract features, user stories, and MVP requirements
Analyze Tech Specs for architecture decisions, data models, and API contracts
Extract UI/UX specifications for component requirements and user flows
Generate hierarchical task roadmaps organized by Phase, Sprint, and Tasks
Identify parallel task opportunities and dependency relationships
Apply structured templates with acceptance criteria and verification steps
limitations: Does not execute tasks or modify project files directly
Does not estimate task duration in hours or days
Does not integrate with external project management tools like Jira or Asana
Requires user to provide specification documents in common paths

use_cases.title: Plan new feature implementation
use_cases.description: Generate a complete sprint roadmap for a new feature from PRD and Tech Specs. The output provides a phased plan with tasks, acceptance criteria, and parallel work opportunities.

use_cases.title: Break down complex project
use_cases.description: Transform comprehensive project specifications into actionable task breakdowns. The skill identifies foundation work, feature phases, and deployment requirements.

use_cases.title: Create sprint backlog
use_cases.description: Generate sprint-ready task items with clear dependencies and acceptance criteria from existing documentation. The output can be copied directly into sprint planning.

prompt_templates.title: Basic roadmap request
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a task roadmap from the PRD at .claude/docs/specs/prd.md and Tech Specs at .claude/docs/specs/tech-specs.md. Organize by Phase: Foundation, Build, Deployment. Include acceptance criteria for each sprint.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants a complete project roadmap from existing specs

prompt_templates.title: Feature-specific breakdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a detailed task breakdown for the [feature name] feature based on the specifications. Include parallel task opportunities, dependency tracking, and verification steps for each task.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants focused breakdown for a specific feature

prompt_templates.title: Sprint planning assistance
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate sprint tasks for [sprint name] from the project specifications. Include task IDs in SPRINT-XXX format, mark parallel-safe tasks with [P], and list acceptance criteria for each task.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs sprint-ready task items with proper formatting

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive spec analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all specification documents (PRD, Tech Specs, UI/UX) and generate a complete implementation roadmap. Use the template at assets/tasks-template.md. Include risks, blockers, and cross-sprint dependencies.
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants full analysis with all template sections

output_examples.input: Generate task roadmap for a new API feature from docs/prd.md
output: - T002 [P]: Configure TypeScript with strict mode
- [ ] All API endpoints have type-safe request handlers
- [ ] Validation errors return proper error responses

output_examples.input: Create sprint backlog for authentication feature
output: - T025 and T026 can run concurrently
- T027 depends on T025 and T026 completion

best_practices: Provide complete specification documents in standard paths before requesting roadmap generation
Review generated acceptance criteria and add specific metrics or thresholds relevant to your project
Use the [P] marker to identify truly independent tasks that can run in parallel
Validate dependency chains match your team's actual work patterns
anti_patterns: Requesting roadmaps without providing specification documents
Accepting generated tasks without customizing acceptance criteria
Ignoring dependency relationships marked in the output
Creating tasks that span multiple domains without splitting them

faq.question: What specifications does this skill require?
faq.answer: The skill looks for PRD, Tech Specs, and UI/UX documents in standard paths like .claude/docs/specs/ or docs/. If documents are missing, it prompts for their locations.

faq.question: Can this skill estimate task duration?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates task structure with acceptance criteria but does not provide time estimates. Use the task breakdown as input for your estimation process.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with Jira or other tools?
faq.answer: No. The output is markdown-formatted for copying into any tool. The structured format can be adapted to import into project management systems.

faq.question: How does the parallel task marking work?
faq.answer: Tasks marked [P] have no dependencies on other tasks in the same sprint. Multiple [P] tasks can run simultaneously. The skill analyzes dependencies to identify these opportunities.

faq.question: What task ID format should I use?
faq.answer: The skill supports sequential (T001, T002) or sprint-prefixed (SPRINT-001: T001-T009) formats. Choose one format and apply it consistently throughout the project.

faq.question: Can I customize the output template?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses assets/tasks-template.md as a template. You can modify this file to add sections, change formatting, or adjust acceptance criteria patterns.
